title: The Forums have sailed off into the sunset
body:
Morning all,

A quick heads - this morning we've placed the Forums into read only mode. We  elected read only because we know there's cool content there people put time and effort into and we want you to be able to revisit and enjoy that in your leisure.

I'd like to thank everybody for being positive and open minded around Boards, and we all look forward to future discussions and lots of cool new League of Legends content! 

GG,

CptStupendous

replies.body: The company name is Riot. They keep forcing changes we don't want on us. I think their intentions are obvious.
Yea, I get that you guys wanted the boards up and all, but why do you have to close the forums? Plenty of people were happy with them.

Yeah they should just keep both open so those who are happy with forum can use forum and those who are happy with board can use board.

Or if you are so desperate to keep people on the Board you can at least let people access forum for limited hours per day or something like that idk.

There was a Q&A done a while ago which you can find [here](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/GD/ITeMWouf-boards-qa-recap)

It answers a lot of questions about the boards like why we did certain things, why we chose these specific colours etc.

But I think this excerpt helps explain why we are moving away form the older forums.

**Pendragon** offered a lengthy response: “We want to build a better forum experience for players, because you deserve it. When we launched League of Legends we picked up some off-the-shelf forum software because we had no idea how big the forums and LoL were going to get. I think it was certainly the right choice at the time but over the long run there have been some pretty significant limitations that stem from that choice.

* **It’s difficult to integrate into the rest of the League of Legends experience.** Remember how long we had those question mark icons? We've been plagued with account authentication issues, etc.

* **It’s extremely challenging to technically scale.** It wasn't built to handle tens of thousands of concurrent readers and tens of thousands of daily posts. Forums going down whenever NA has stability issues, etc.

* **It’s extremely challenging to extend.** Doing seemingly easy things like adding search that “every other forum has” would involve months of hacky engineering work and is still not incredibly reliable. The time-cost of any given feature that we’re building on this technology is a fraction of what the same work would have been on the classic forums.

* **It wasn't built to handle moderation at scale.** The toolset that allows large teams of 24x7 moderators to effectively collaborate just really didn't exist in the software. And it shouldn't have because we were using it in a way that it wasn't intended to be used.

Building our own Boards platform - while a significant effort – goes a long way towards making the future better. It allows us to build forward-looking features and functionality, and lets us experiment to find the best types of community experiences.

Yeah but old forum had most of the stuff better than this new one.

Tbh if you just add the new features like the champ/item/summoner's spell icons and easier picture attachments etc onto the old forum, it is the best forum experience you guys are looking for.

Also old forum doesn't kill off fun little threads like GD Tier List.

I like how on the Board you can jump between different regions without making smurfs but that's kinda it sadly.

So the 'small things' that you think are small, really aren't small additions.

Just like the launcher, we wanted all this fancy stuff, but in reality it just wasn't going to happen with the restrictions that were layed out when it was first designed. Hence the new launcher/patcher.

Forums and Boards aren't "gamechanging", I believe we should be able to go between the two. Besides the fact, OCE forums is not popular anyway and I doubt Boards will be as well. So I don't see why we had to transition something new when forums were perfectly fine tbh. From what I remember, one of the main reasons why they introduced Boards was because threads were being "drowned out". However, most forum-goers will know this is not the case. 
Ah well, hopefully I can see myself posting regularly, but it seems like quite a disappointment to Riot

You just have to take the time to learn it instead of just dismissing it as bad.
